alert.note: Alert for Boulder (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 07 at 8:13PM MDT until August 07 at 9:15PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM MDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Boulder. * WHEN...Until 1115 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 813 PM MDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Up to 0.5 inches of rain have fallen just northwest of the Calwood burn area. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... mainly rural areas of North Central Boulder County
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks, gulches, roads and roadside culverts in the Calwood burn area. The heavy rains could also trigger rock slides or debris flows. The main areas of concern are Heil Valley Ranch and Lefthand Creek just above US 36.
